brief_summary.textblock:
This 2-arm, open-label, non-randomized study will investigate the absolute bioav ailability,
      pharmacokinetics, mass balance, and routes of elimination of GDC-003 2 as well as its safety
      in healthy volunteers. Patients will receive either a si ngle oral dose of GDC-0032 followed
      by a 14C-labeled IV dose of GDC-0032 or a si ngle oral dose of 14C-labelled GDC-0032.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Bioavailability and Pharmacokinetic Study of GDC-0032 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1 STUDY TO INVESTIGATE THE ABSOLUTE BIOAVAILABILITY OF GDC-0032 AND THE ABSORPTION, METABOLISM, AND EXCRETION OF [14C]-GDC-0032 IN HEALTHY MALE SUBJECTS

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Bioavailability: Absolute bioavailability of GDC-0032 (Area under the concentration-time curve [AUC])
Elimination & PK: Amount of drug excreted in urine/feces over the sampling interval
Elimination & PK: Maximum concentration (Cmax) of GDC-0032
Elimination & PK: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC)
Elimination & PK: Total radioactivity concentrations in whole blood, plasma, urine, and feces.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination & PK: Metabolite identification in plasma, urine, & feces

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
